intro: Cicerbita sonchoides, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia, and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into small, spiny fruits. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial, typically reaching heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
